result.execSummary:
The defendant Chelsey Viernette Davis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: Any other sentence; Huber privileges for work, school, and treatment

miscConds.notes: Pay mandatory $200.00 DNA surcharge to be paid at a rate of $25.00 per month, commencing 04-30-15 until paid in full. If unpaid, a civil judgment will be ordered filed against the defendant. Court ordered all other costs and surcharges WAIVED, due to defendant's financial situation.

- Defendant to successfully complete any shop-lifting/theft counseling deemed appropriate by the department.
- Make diligent efforts to seek/maintain full time employment or school, or a combination of both.
- Defendant is to take steps, starting today to establish paternity for her 3 children that paternity has not been established on.

timeConds.notes: STAYED; to be used by the probation department, if they feel sanctions are appropriate. Straight time.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Chelsey Viernette Davis

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Chelsey Viernette Davis in court with attorney Scott Alan Wales.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint. Judgment of conviction entered. 
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.
Defendant ordered to serve 4 months in the House of Correction consecutive to any other sentence with credit of (0) days time served, and with Huber Privileges for work, school, and treatment. 
*Court ordered 30 days, Conditioned time, STAYED, to be used by the probation department if they feel sanctions are appropriate.  These days would be served Straight time. 
Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 12 months with the following conditions:
Defendant to successfully complete any shop-lifting/theft counseling deemed appropriate by the department. 
*Make diligent efforts to seek and maintain full time employment or school, or a combination of the both.
*Defendant is to take steps, starting today to establish paternity for her 3 children that paternity has not been established on. 
*Defendant to pay mandatory $200.00 DNA surcharge to be paid at a rate of $25.00 per month, commencing 4-30-2015 until paid in full.   If unpaid, a civil judgment will be ordered filed against the defendant.
Court ordered all other costs and surcharges by WAIVED due to defendant's financial situation. 
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.  Deputy Court Clerk jks

Defendant Chelsey Viernette Davis in court with attorney Scott Alan Wales.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 46. jks  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 03-30-2015 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for 02-12-2015 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Chelsey Viernette Davis
Current: 2138 North 32nd Street, Milwaukee, WI 53208   (Effective: 01-20-2015)
Prior: 2138 North 32nd Street, Milwaukee, WI 53208
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

As an additional condition of bail:
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with the Target retail store on North 124th Street, City of Wauwatosa

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Siefert.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Reserve Judge, Branch 46.

Defendant plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 46.

Defendant Chelsey Viernette Davis in court with attorney Scott Alan Wales.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
OCCR Tape #15-012

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to Defendant's attorney.  
Clerk:  jms
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 1/20/15 @ 1:30pm
